comments: The Gilbert Lab is so awesome!! Everyone is really nice and so knowledgeable about their topics.

The Gilbert lab is fantastic, Prof. Gilbert is interesting, insightful, and as enthusiastic as he is in his lectures.  The grad students all are very thoughtful and interesting, and very friendly to undergrads.
The gilbert lab is great! You get to learn how the research process works! Bethany is the best grad student ever!
Work in a lab for one of your classes! It is a fun, easy, interesting, and unique experience for one of your courses.
Working in this lab is so much fun and you get to talk a lot about social psych
If you have the 10 hours to dedicate per week to this class, it's definitely a great choice and a constructive hands-on experience.

You do not get to interact often with Professor Gilbert himself, but the experience is in discussing psychology with equally passionate lab members in very personable and easygoing meetings. This lab is extremely fun to work in and it made me thoroughly enjoy social psychology.
This is a truly engaging class, especially those interested in social psych!

This class gives you a good taste of what it is like to be a researcher in Psychology because it offers the rare chance for undergraduates to do experiments on actual subjects. 10 hours a week may seem like a lot, but it's worth the time an efforts you put into it.

If you're interested in psychology or looking for a fun and interesting course to take in general, take this course! You will not regret it! The people at professor Gilbert's lab are amazing and helpful!
This is a fantastic opportunity to step outside of a classroom and explore the field of psychology!
Really cool lab with really great people!
This is a very fun lab to work in! You can make your own schedule and people are fun!

Being part of a lab is a valuable experience, but being a research assistant is not especially stimulating intellectually. It's a good way to get a sense of what kind of research goes on in psychology laboratories but the actual running of studies is not especially valuable.
This is a great way to get in-depth experience about psychology and doing science that is completely applicable.

Daniel Gilbert's lab is a bustling atmosphere full of energy and fun discussion of social psychology. I loved lab meetings and found the experiments running in his lab extremely interesting. He is extremely personable, and his graduate student Bethany runs the lab meetings both efficiently and with a friendly smile. Best lab ever!!
This is a great way to see what psychology research is like from the other side! I really enjoyed working with everyone in the lab as well.

Working in the Gilbert Lab was a really good experience. I got to participate in all parts of the experiment process, including brainstorming for a follow-up experiment, running the experiment, and preparing a talk about it.

This lab is great! Awesome people who are working on relevant and interesting studies. This lab is great if you want to see whether or not conducting psychology research is something that you might want to do in the future!
One of my favorite experiences at Harvard.

The Gilbert lab is a lovely group of people who do fascinating research. Working here was absolutely the best part of my semester. While it's not demanding at baseline, you'll get a lot more out of the experience if you're willing to take on more responsibility and get deeply involved in projects.

It was such an amazing experience. It definitely requires a lot of time and effort, and is very rewarding. However, make sure that you are willing to put in the requisite amount of time. As long as you are, you will love the course. Being able to take part in all aspects of the research process was a very great experience for me as a psychology concentrator.
Great call for a lab requirement.
The Gilbert Lab is great! You will be given the opportunity to collaborate with Psychology Graduate students on their studies and facilitate scheduling and running participants.
Great course. Great way to get exposure to a lab and switch up the classic schedule of having 4 classes. Perfect class for people interested in psychology research and meeting cool people!
Incredible learning experience along with not a huge amount of work load.
Great course!

The Gilbert lab is awesome! You work under a grad student on whatever line of research needs assistance. The expectations are totally fair and your designated time in the lab can easily be figured out to fit your schedule. If you're lucky like I was, though, most of your time will be spent outside the lab brainstorming/researching ways to test your hypothesis and creating experiment stimuli. There are weekly journal club discussions where every RA reads the same article(s) and you discuss them as a lab. This helped the lab feel like a community and facilitated everyone getting to know each other and their work. Finally, rather than write a paper, the Gilbert lab has each RA give a PowerPoint presentation at the end of the semester to show Dan and the rest of the RAs and grad students what they worked on. This was a great capstone to an enjoyable semester. If you're thinking about working in a lab at some point, this is a fantastic option!

If you hope to get a better idea of how psychological experiments work and would like to get hands-on experience with data analysis, this is the course for you. Also if you loved SLS-20 with Gilbert, this is a great opportunity to interact with him and gain even more of his wisdom.

This is an excellent lab to be in if you are looking for a rigorous and hands-on, but extremely enjoyable experience with other great and highly motivated students. The lab grants students a lot more freedom than others on campus, but be prepared to hold your own and take a lot of initiative in the research process. Overall, I would highly recommend working here.
One of the best things I have done at Harvard. Dan & David made my experience utterly worthwhile and I am so glad I did it.
If you want lab experience, I would highly recommend working at the gilbert lab. The hours are flexible and they have really interesting projects going on!

This lab is such a great way to engage with all aspects of the psychology research process that you hear about in other classes but do not always get to experience hands on. Working with data has been such a valuable way to gain a deeper understanding of psychology but also develop my quantitative skills that will serve me well in the world of business. It is also so inspiring to work under Professor Gilbert and many of the top up and coming psychologists. The lab is a lot of work, but it is also so much fun, and my lab group and I became such great friends throughout my years here.

This is definitely one of the best psych labs at Harvard. You're expected to work at a very high level and produce excellent work, but it's a really enjoyable experience and everyone in the lab is really great to work with.

This lab is very good at preparing you for work in the real psychology world. It also gives you great exposure to Dan Gilbert while also giving you brilliant mentors in the grad students. Would recommend highly.
Great people and fun research!

You get great exposure to research with a great group of research assistants in the Gilbert Lab each semester. We always work on something new in Bethany's lab, and its great to get a range of experiences.

Working in the Gilbert Lab with David is a very rewarding experience. You are able to take an active part in fascinating research projects and see what the day-to-day life of a researcher is like. The meetings you have with the entire Gilbert Lab and Prof. Gilbert are inspiring and fascinating.
There is a high level of expectation in terms of prior knowledge and skill, but the workload is not that intense and you definitely learn a lot about how to actually conduct psychological research.
Highly recommend the Gilbert lab if you're looking for a lab course. Low time commitment but good lab experience. The best part is the science fair at the end of the semester.

This class has been the cornerstone of my independent work at Harvard. I have learnt the highs and lows of being a post doc but also I have trained deeply in various lab techniques. Big plus in my book
Working with Bethany in the Gilbert lab is always enjoyable. If you are looking for research experience, don't hesitate to try out this lab.

If you're a psych student considering a lab, definitely make it the Gilbert lab! A lot of my friends in other psych labs have to undergo brutal, menial work (like spend 10H+ coding videos), but this definitely isn't the case with Gilbert's lab: you're constantly doing meaningful, thoughtful work that actually impacts the course of your lab mentor's research. All the people in this lab are incredible too: unlike other labs, the post-grads you work with here are extremely down to earth and have an awesome sense of humor, so it makes every encounter with them enjoyable. Plus, every week, I honestly looked forward to days when I came to this lab to work on research, and my relationship with my lab mentor became one of the best mentor ships/experiences I've had at Harvard. You really need to participate in this lab - I guarantee that you won't regret it!
You should definitely look into doing this for any sort of future research work just to get a gauge of what's going on in the lab.
this is a really unique course that lets you get real lab experience and work with cool post-docs on their experiments

even if it is not the exact research you are interested in, it is such a great experience and you get to know people/professors that you can keep in touch with and help guide you with future decisions
Great way to get to see the in's on how psych studies work and also great way to get to know the guys in the lab, like Dan and David

This class is legitimately one of the best classes you can take at Harvard. You will learn a lot about the entire process of running studies and analyzing data in a super low stress and fun environment. The whole department is absolutely incredible, and working with Gus this semester was a ton of fun. He is an absolute homie, and I 100% recommend working with him.

TAKE THIS COURSE!! especially if you found SLS 20 enjoyable. The course is not a heavy time requirement at all. I used it as my fifth class and I absolutely loved it. You only meet about once or so a week, and you are able to get amazing hands on experience in psychology. Each of the mentors are amazing (especially Gus!) and are always willing to just chat about anything. Great great course. Will be taking it every year.
